sendit.handlers package¶

Submodules¶

sendit.handlers.arp_handler module¶

Creates class that listens and responds to ARP messages

class sendit.handlers.arp_handler.ARP_Listener(interface=None, reply=True, mappings=None)¶

Bases: object

Parameters

  • interface (String) – string name of interface to respond to ARP messages on, defaults to None

  • reply (Boolean) – boolean of whether to answer ARP requests, defaults to True

  • mappings (dictionary with String keys and values, defaults to None) – dictionary mapping MAC addresses to IPv4 addressses defaults to None. Required if reply is True

Raises

ValueError – when reply is set to true but mappings is not defined or when keys in mappings are not valid IPv4 addresses or when values in mappings are not valid MAC addresses

listen(queue)¶

listens and responds for ARP messages coming in on queue, put there by an ethernet_handler

Parameters

queue (Queue) – Queue which will contain EtherFrames with ARP messages in them

sendit.handlers.ethernet_handler module¶

Creates class that listens and responds to Layer2 Etherframes

class sendit.handlers.ethernet_handler.Ethernet_Listener(interface, protocols)¶

Bases: object

Parameters

  • interface (String) – Interface to be listening on

  • protocols (dictionary) – dictonary where keys are MACs, values are list of layer 3 protocol listeners

add_listener(mac, listener)¶

Add a higher protocol layer listener into ethernet listener for management

Parameters

  • mac (String) – mac address to listen on

  • listener (Protocol Listener Object such as IPv4_Listener, ARP_Listener, IPv6_Listener) – listener object to add

create_threads(mac, protocols)¶

creates threads for each upper layer listener provided in protocols list. Also appends threads and queues created to self.threads and self.queues

Parameters

  • mac (String) – string mac address to create thread and queue for

  • protocols (list) – list of higher layer protocol listeners that need threads and queues instantiated

listen()¶

listens in on self.interface with a raw_nic if incoming etherframe has destination of a mac in self.macs to listen for, the frames etype field is checked to see if there is a corresponding listener for this mac and protocol if there is, the frame is passed into the corresponding queue for that mac/protocol thread if not, frame is discarded

remove_MAC(mac)¶

Remove MAC address from list of macs that listener will listen for Removes corresponding entries in self.mac, self.queues, and self.threads

Parameters

mac (String) – string of mac address to remove

remove_listener(mac, protocol)¶

Remove upper layer listener from Ethernet_Listener Removes corresponding entries in self.threads and self.queues, and if no more entries for a particular mac, corresponding mac is also removed from self.macs

Parameters

  • mac (String) – string of mac address to remove corresponding listener

  • protocol (String) – protocol of listener to remove

Raises

ValueError – if mac not valid MAC address

sendit.handlers.ipv4_handler module¶

Creates class that listens and responds to Layer 3 IPv4

class sendit.handlers.ipv4_handler.IPv4_Listener(ips, listeners=None)¶

Bases: object

Parameters

  • ips (list of Strings) – list of ips to listen for

  • listeners (dictionary where keys are strings of IPv4 addresses, values are Layer 4 protocol listener objects) – dictionary mapping list of upper layer listeners to IPv4 addresses to forward frames to, defaults to None

ip_fragmentation_handler(frame)¶

This pieces back together fragmented packets. This is a modified version of the algorithm defined in RFC 815 https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc815

Parameters

frame (EtherFrame) – ethernet frame that contains fragmented packet

listen(queue)¶

Listens for frames coming in from queue, placed there by a Layer2 Listener If incoming frame contains IPv4 address destination contained in self.ips they are then passed to their respective higher level listeners Otherwise, they are discarded If frames come in with IPv4 fragmented, they are sent to ip_fragmentation_handler to be handled

Parameters

queue (Queue object) – Queue object to listen for incoming frames on

sendit.handlers.ipv6_handler module¶

Creates class that listens and responds to Layer 3 IPv6

class sendit.handlers.ipv6_handler.IPv6_Listener(ips, listeners=None)¶

Bases: object

Parameters

  • ips (List of Strings) – list of IPs to listen for

  • listeners (dictionary with keys of String IPv6 addresses and values are upper layer listeners) – dictionary mapping list of upper layer listeners to IPv6 addresses to forward frames to, defaults to None

listen(queue)¶

Listen for frames coming in on queue to parse the IPv6 objects inside

Parameters

queue (Queue object) – Queue to listen in on

sendit.handlers.raw_nic module¶

Set of classes that creates abstraction for dealing with raw_sockets

class sendit.handlers.raw_nic.Async_Raw_NIC(interface)¶

Bases: socket.socket

Child Class of Socket Creates Asynchronous Raw Socket, binds to provided interface Implements send method that works with rest of library

Parameters

interface (String) – string name of network interface ex: eth0, wlan0. Not sure? Call ifconfig and look at interface names

async recv(n_bytes, queues=None)¶

Asynchronously receive bytes

Parameters

  • queues – queues to send raw bytes to

  • n_bytes (int) – Number of bytes to receive

send(frame, n_bytes)¶

Overrides Socket send method Attempts to use as_bytes() method that is provided by all protocol classes in this library If not a class in this libary, calls str.encode on provided frame Them sends on raw socket

Parameters

frame (L2 object that has as_bytes function, such as Etherframe) – frame to send on Raw_NIC

class sendit.handlers.raw_nic.Raw_NIC(interface)¶

Bases: socket.socket

Child Class of Socket Creates Raw Socket, binds to provided interface Implements send method that works with rest of library

Parameters

interface (String) – string name of network interface ex: eth0, wlan0. Not sure? Call ifconfig and look at interface names

send(frame)¶

Overrides Socket send method Attempts to use as_bytes() method that is provided by all protocol classes in this library If not a class in this libary, calls str.encode on provided frame Them sends on raw socket

Parameters

frame (L2 object that has as_bytes function, such as Etherframe) – frame to send on Raw_NIC

sendit.handlers.udp_handler module¶

Creates class that listens and responds to Layer 4 UDP

class sendit.handlers.udp_handler.UDP_Listener(ports, listeners=None)¶

Bases: object

Parameters

  • ports (list of ints) –

    • list of ports to listen on

  • listeners (dictionary of listener objects) – default of None, dictionary mapping list of upper layer listeners to UDP to forward frames to

listen(queue)¶

Listen for frames coming in on queue to parse the UDP objects inside

Parameters

queue (Queue object) – Queue to listen in on
